issuetype.name: Build Story

issuetype.description: Build Stories track development or implementation effort required to deliver a feature.
issuetype.name: Build Story

content.text: As an enabling solution squad, I want to enhance the workflow, so that it is correctly assigned.
Acceptance Criteria
Functional Criteria:
When:
service_requested = “Provision New Database Instance”
target_aws_azure_rdbms = “RDS for Oracle” or “Oracle on IaaS” or target_on_premise_rdbms = “Oracle on Linux“
target_aws_azure_edition = “Enterprise” or target_on_premise_edition = “Enterprise”
Then:
Assign this service request  to  "OPS - Cloud Transformation Architecture - ITSVC0010916" for approval.
After approval, the RITM and TASK should be assigned to Professional Services.

fields.summary: Enhance the workflow to assign the request to "ITSVC0010916 - Cloud Transformation Architecture" for approval when Provision New Database is Oracle and Enterprise

issuetype.name: Enabler Story

content.text: As a enabling solution squad member, I want perform a research for client script, so that will allow us to have a better control for the field that sre hide or show in the form.
Acceptance Criteria
Functional Criteria:
perform a research about how client script could replace the UI Policy in order to hide and Show fields in the form based in the different selection.
Client script need to run based in a master table that will contain the rules means the client script will read the table and will apply the hide/show functionality

fields.summary: Research of Client Script to replace UI Policy for Hide/unhide fields in the form

issuetype.name: Build Story

content.text: As a DBaaS customer, I want to always use the IT service is the default, so that i am not asked to select.
The option for database instance should not be available in PS forms
Acceptance Criteria
Functional Criteria:

Identify specific user tasks, functions or business processes that must be in place. A functional criterion might be “A user is able to access a list of available reports.” A non-functional criterion might be “Edit buttons and Workflow buttons comply with the Site Button Design.”
Non-Functional Criteria:

Identify specific non-functional conditions the implementation must meet, such as design elements. A non-functional criterion might be “Edit buttons and Workflow buttons comply with the Site Button Design.”
Performance Criteria:

If specific performance is critical to the acceptance of a user story, it should be included. This is often measured as a response time, and should be spelled out as a threshold such as “1-2 seconds for a query response.”
